sen.j: 国人らは本領とは別に守護から給分田を与えられていたのである。
sen.e: It means that Kokujin and others were provided Kyubun-den (bonus rice field) from Shugo besides their territories.
It means that Kokujin and others were provided Kyubun-den (bonus rice field) from Shugo besides their territories.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: It means that kokujin and others were provided kyubun-den (bonus rice field) from shugo besides their territories.
sen.cmt: kokujin, kyubun-den 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 被官国人らへの軍役について見ると、本領分・給分ごとに課せられた例も散見され、国人支配がまだ一元化していなかったことを表す。
sen.e: Concerning the military service assigned to the vassalized Kokujin, there were several cases that the service was imposed considering the scale of territory and Kyubun (bonus), which suggests that the control over the Kokujin had not yet been unified.

sen.e: Concerning the military service assigned to the vassalized kokujin, there were several cases that the service was imposed considering the scale of territory and kyubun (bonus), which suggests that the control over the kokujin had not yet been unified.
sen.cmt: kokujin, kyubun 小文字にしました。

sen.j: ほとんどの守護は、幕府の枢要メンバーとして京都もしくは鎌倉に常住しており、実際の領国経営は、直属家臣や国人層から選んだ守護代に任せていた。
sen.e: Most Shugo were permanently stationed in Kyoto or Kamakura as key members of Bakufu, leaving the actual territory management to the Shugo-dai (deputy of Shugo), who were selected out of vessels under the direct supervision of Shugo and the Kokujin stratum.

Most Shugo were permanently stationed in Kyoto or Kamakura as key members of Bakufu, leaving the actual territory management to the Shugo-dai (deputy of Shugo), who were selected from vessels under the direct supervision of Shugo and the Kokujin stratum.
sen.cmt: Flow
sen.e: Most shugo were permanently stationed in Kyoto or Kamakura as key members of bakufu, leaving the actual territory management to the shugo-dai (deputy of shugo), who were selected from vassals under the direct supervision of shugo and the kokujin stratum.
sen.cmt: bakufu, shugo 小文字にしました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 15世紀後期、応仁の乱から明応の政変にかけて、幕府の支配体制が流動化していくと、守護代や有力国人が守護に代わって、領国支配の実権を握る例も見られるようになった。
sen.e: With the unrest spreading over the ruling system of Bakufu in the period of the Onin War to the Meio Coup in the late 15th century, some Shugo-dai and influential Kokujin hold real power in ruling the manor instead of Shugo.

With unrest spreading over the ruling system of the Bakufu in the period of the Onin War to the Meio Coup in the late 15th century, some Shugo-dai and influential Kokujin held real power in ruling the manor instead of Shugo.
sen.cmt: Flow
sen.e: With unrest spreading over the ruling system of the bakufu in the period of the Onin War to the Meio Coup in the late 15th century, some shugo-dai and influential kokujin held real power in ruling the territories instead of shugo.
sen.cmt: shugo-dai, kokujin 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 守護の人民支配は、段銭・棟別銭や守護役などの課役を国内一律に賦課することによって行われた。
sen.e: Shugo controlled people nationwide by uniformly imposing taxes and duties such as Tan-sen and Munabechi-sen and Shugo-yaku (service duty under Shugo) on them.
sen.cmt: 守護役の読み方が不明です。「やく」で訳しました。
sen.e: Shugo controlled people nationwide by uniformly imposing taxes and duties such as Tan-sen and Munabechi-sen and Shugo-yaku (service duty under Shugo) on them.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: Shugo controlled people nationwide by uniformly imposing taxes and duties such as tan-sen and munabechi-sen as well as shugo-yaku (service duty under shugo) on them.
sen.cmt: tan-sen, munabechi-sen 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 段銭・棟別銭とは、元来、朝廷・幕府が臨時経費の調達のため、守護に命じて国内に均一に賦課する租税だった。
sen.e: Tan-sen and Munabechi-sen were originally accounted among land taxes uniformly imposed on people nationwide, which were collected by Shugo under the instruction of the Imperial Court and Bakufu aiming at raising extra money.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: Tan-sen and munabechi-sen were originally accounted among land taxes uniformly imposed on people nationwide, which were collected by shugo under the instruction of the Imperial Court and bakufu aiming at raising extra money.
sen.cmt: bakufu 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 後に守護が独自で賦課する守護段銭へ変質した。
sen.e: However, those taxes were later changed to Shugo-tansen, the Tan-sen imposed by Shugo in their own right.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, those taxes were later changed to Shugo-tansen, the Tan-sen imposed by Shugo in their own right.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: However, those taxes were later changed to shugo-tansen, the tan-sen imposed by shugo in their own right.
sen.cmt: tan-sen 小文字にしました。

sen.j: また守護役とは、守護が独自に領内の百姓らへ賦課した各種課役であり、多くは夫役（労働課役）の形態を取った。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Shugo-yaku meant various duties imposed on peasants in the manor by Shugo in their own rights, most of which were performed by Buyaku (labor service).
Meanwhile, Shugo-yaku meant various duties imposed on peasants in the manor by Shugo in their own rights, most of which were performed by Buyaku (labor service).
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: Meanwhile, shugo-yaku meant various duties imposed on peasants in the territory by shugo in their own rights, most of which were performed by bu-yaku (labor service).
sen.cmt: shugo-yaku, bu-yaku 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 守護役は、村落を単位として賦課されることが多かった。
sen.e: The Shugo-yaku was often imposed on each village as a unit.
The Shugo-yaku was often imposed on each village as a unit.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: The shugo-yaku was often imposed on each village as a unit.
sen.cmt: shugo-yaku 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 室町期の人民は、国人層では国人一揆（国人領主連合）などの、村落の百姓らでは惣村・郷村などの結合形態をとっていた。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, people formed various unions including Kokujin-ikki (Kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) union) formed by the people in the Kokujin stratum, as well as Soson (a community consisting of peasants' self-governing association) and Goson (autonomous village) formed by peasants living in villages.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, people formed various unions including Kokujin-ikki (Kokujin ryoshu (local samurai lord) union) formed by the people in the Kokujin stratum, as well as Soson (a community consisting of peasants' self-governing association) and Goson (autonomous village) formed by peasants living in villages.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, people formed various unions including Kokujin-ikki (kokujin ryoshu [local samurai lord] union) formed by the people in the kokujin stratum, as well as soson (a community consisting of peasants' self-governing association) and goson (autonomous village) formed by peasants living in villages.
sen.cmt: soson, goson 小文字にしました。

sen.j: いずれも守護の支配を受けていた反面、その独立性をある程度、守護から認められてもいた。
sen.e: While all of the unions were controlled by Shugo on the one hand, they were allowed to be independent to some extent on the other hand.
sen.cmt: 一例文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: While all of the unions were controlled by Shugo on the one hand, they were allowed to be independent to some extent on the other hand.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: While all of the unions were controlled by shugo on the one hand, they were allowed to be independent to some extent on the other hand.
sen.cmt: shugo 小文字にしました。

sen.j: 守護領国制における人民支配は必ずしも強固なものではなかったが、時代を追うごとに人民支配は深化していった。
sen.e: The control over people was not always strict in the Shugo-ryogoku system, but it became stricter with the times.
The control over people was not always strict in the Shugo-ryogoku system, but it became stricter with the times.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: The control over people was not always strict in the shugo-ryogoku system, but it became stricter with the times.
sen.cmt: shugo 小文字にしました。

tit.e: Change to the Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord)-ryogoku system (the system that Daimyo controls feudal domains)
Change to the Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord)-ryogoku system (the system that Daimyo control feudal domains)
Change to the daimyo-ryogoku system (the system that daimyo control feudal domains)

sen.j: 守護領国制は、それまでの武家の支配体制に比べると、一円的な支配を進めたという点で画期的だった。
sen.e: The Shugo-ryogoku system was epoch-making in that it promoted the comprehensive control, compared with the conventional ruling system under samurai family.

sen.cmt: shugo 小文字にしました。

sen.j: しかし上述したように必ずしも国人層・百姓層などを厳格に支配していたわけではなかった。
sen.e: However, as mentioned above, the Shugo-ryogoku system did not always control strictly the Kokujin stratum and the peasant stratum.

sen.cmt: shugo, kokujin 小文字にしました。

sen.j: しかし、15世紀末から社会体制の流動化が顕著になると、より強固な支配体制を領国に布く必要が生じた。
sen.e: With the social system becoming remarkably unstable in the end of the 15th century, it became necessary to apply stricter control system to manor.
With the social system becoming remarkably unstable in the end of the 15th century, it became necessary to apply stricter control system to manors.
sen.cmt: Flow
sen.e: With the social system becoming remarkably unstable in the end of the 15th century, it became necessary to apply stricter control system to territories.

sen.j: こうした変化に対応できた守護もしくは守護を放伐した守護代・国人らは、守護不入権などを否認して強力かつ一元的に領国を支配する戦国大名へと成長した。
sen.e: Denying various disadvantageous terms such as the right of Shugo-funyu, Shugo that had successfully coped with these changes, as well as Shugo-dai and Kokujin that had ousted Shugo, grew into the Daimyo in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) controlling manor strongly and uniformly.

sen.e: Denying various disadvantageous terms such as the right of shugo-funyu, shugo that had successfully coped with these changes, as well as shugo-dai and kokujin that had ousted shugo, grew into Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period [period of warring states]) controlling their territories strongly and uniformly.
sen.cmt: manor →territories としました。戦国大名 表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 変化に対応できなかった守護は没落した。
sen.e: On the other hand, Shugo that had failed to cope with these changes went to ruin.

sen.j: 戦国大名が登場すると、守護大名の存在を前提とした守護領国制も変質し、守護領国制は事実上解体されて、大名領国制と呼ばれる体制へ移行した。
sen.e: With the appearance of the Daimyo in the Sengoku period, the Shugo-ryogoku system, for which the existence of Shugo-daimyo was prerequisite, was changed and dissolved in fact, replaced with the system called "Daimyo-ryogoku sei" (Daimyo-ryogoku system).
